p:
Next, phosphoric acid reacts with metal which is oxidized to ferrous cation (Fe 2+) followed by reaction between phosphate anion and ferrous anion, resulting in the formation of ferric phosphate [ 30]. During this reaction, the protons from an acidic solution and are reduced to hydrogen (H 2) [ 30] according to the reactions shown below: Fe → Fe 2+ + 2e − (5)
2H + + 2e − → H 2 (6)
Fe 2+ + PO 4 3− → FePO 4 + e − (7)
